name: Jehna Ackerley CV
body:
##Jehna Ackerley
jwilhelmackerley@gmail.com
  
I am driven by connecting dots, illuminating relationships, and exploring patterns. I am hyper interested in feedback loops and communication platforms especially in problem-solving. I seek to employ my meaningful research and strategy into innovative design for people and the applications/tools they engage with in their lives.


###Education    
***
**Antioch University Seattle** MA in Whole Systems Design, June 2014  
*Certificates in Integrated Skills for Sustainable Change and Systems Thinking & Design*

**Antioch University Seattle** BA in Liberal Studies, Dual concentration in Psychology and Global Studies, June 2012

**University of Paris I: Panthéon-Sorbonne** Baccalaureate in French Cultural Studies, 2001


###Experience
***
**Consultant/Principal Researcher**, *Bricoleur Collective*  
Integrative research and evaluation to promote social innovation and resilient communities.

**Organizer**, *United Nations Association of Greater Seattle*, October 2011 - December 2014  
Strategic Development/Events Committee Chair/Board of Directors  
● Designed community engagement events and programs  
● Collaborated on organizational analysis and development efforts  
● Led organizational design projects  
● Organized and facilitated meetings and events  

**Outcomes Assessment Graduate Researcher**, *Antioch University Seattle*, October 2012 - June 2014  
● Facilitated the program assessment of student learning through data analysis, synthesis, and story extraction  
● Communicated key findings in assessment reports and presentations  
● Collaborated in cross analysis and integration  

**Recording Artist**, *Kranky Records & The Riley Bushman Recordings & Archives*, 2004-2010  
Artistic Conception & Development/Experimental Music  
● Composed, recorded, and toured in electronic music  project  
● Translated creative concepts into design  
● Co-created and managed independent music label

**Sales Consultant**, *Appliance Smart*, May 2006 - February 2010  
Client Consultation/Trend and Product Research

**Response Center Technician**, *Armorgroup North America Inc*, January 2003 - October 2004  
● Researched world developments and identified areas of threat for client base  
● Created security reports which included travel briefings, client threat assessments, and recommendations for further exploration


###Research and Design Methods  
***
**Qualitative research**, active interviewing, observation, field research, case studies, group consultation, surveys, ethnographic mapping, assessment & reporting, and design charrettes

**Data Analysis & Integration**

**Systems thinking**, social innovation design, integrative science research, communication, storytelling, and problem-solving

**Facilitation**, strategic questioning, group dynamics, and power-mapping


**Sustainable Change**, reflective analysis and design, social construction, cultural patterns and value systems, and adaptive leadership
